963358450b1375723ef9a74ad68733e8 (07:30): Sorry, I asked this a couple of hours ago, but didn't get a response.  Going to reask. ;)  Is there a way to change the order in which 'suggestions' come up whenever you use auto-completion (CTRL-N)?  Ideally i'd like to have the 'smallest-number-of-character' match show up first, all the way to the longest.
963358450b1375723ef9a74ad68733e8 (07:30): Ideally, bash-style autocompletion would be fantastic.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (07:31): I don't think so, KhaZ
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (07:31): ^P is oftentimes more useful
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (07:31): because that will be the most recently used one
963358450b1375723ef9a74ad68733e8 (07:31): Really?  What's the difference, if you don't mind me asking?
963358450b1375723ef9a74ad68733e8 (07:31): ^P is most recently used?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (07:31): ^P searches up (previous)
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (07:31): ^N searches down (next)
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (07:32): usually you (or at least I) want something just a little bit up
963358450b1375723ef9a74ad68733e8 (07:32): Fair enough.  Tha tworks.
963358450b1375723ef9a74ad68733e8 (07:33): I wonder how it stores the 'matches'.

0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (07:35): or at least, when completing includes, it has to go read the files every single time
